abstract.p: France Telecom will sell its shares in Orange mobile telephone business next year (S)

block.p: France's dominant phone company, France Telecom, said it would sell shares in Orange, the mobile phone business it bought from Vodafone AirTouch, early next year. The statement comes as a steep decline in the share prices of many telecommunications stocks has caused analysts to question whether certain large equity deals scheduled to come to market in the next few months will proceed as planned. France Telecom declined to comment on whether the size of the Orange offering would be scaled back from original expectations.

France's dominant phone company, France Telecom, said it would sell shares in Orange, the mobile phone business it bought from Vodafone AirTouch, early next year. The statement comes as a steep decline in the share prices of many telecommunications stocks has caused analysts to question whether certain large equity deals scheduled to come to market in the next few months will proceed as planned. France Telecom declined to comment on whether the size of the Orange offering would be scaled back from original expectations.
